benchmark_details.name: CODEJUDGE
benchmark_details.overview: CODEJUDGE is a framework that leverages large language models (LLMs) to evaluate code generation by determining the semantic correctness of generated code without the need for test cases.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the semantic correctness of code generated by large language models.

data.annotation: Human-annotated scores for code usefulness and correctness based on expert review.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated to measure the correlation between CODEJUDGE assessments and ground truth values.
methodology.interpretation: High correlation scores indicate reliable evaluations, highlighting differences between evaluated code and reference solutions.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved 0.612 and 0.562 Spearman’s coefficients on HumanEval-X and CoNaLa respectively.
methodology.validation: Validated using external datasets and statistical correlation metrics.
